intro: Cirsium yachiyotakashimae, commonly known as the Yachiyotakashima thistle, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pinkish flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered flowers in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
